tweet: The President's threat to impose up to a 25 percent tariff on goods from Mexico is self-defeating, illogical and frankly dumb. It puts our economy at risk by harming Arizona businesses, workers and consumers.

It is time for the House to take the extraordinary step of opening an impeachment inquiry. My full statement here: https://stanton.house.gov/media/press-releases/stanton-statement-regarding-opening-impeachment-inquiry …

Our state’s economy and its future are stronger when we work together. On Memorial Day, we honor the service and sacrifice of our fallen heroes. Today is a day to reflect on the lives of those service women and men and remember all they have given to our country. pic.twitter.com/A8kbn5HlEg

The Trump Administration just announced its plan to roll back the Health Care Rights Law, which protects patients from discrimination on the basis of sex and gender identity. This is yet another blatant strike against the LGBTQ community and women—and we won't stand for it.

Jerry Emmett represented the best of our state. She was 104 when she passed away last month. Today, @RepKirkpatrick, @RepOHalleran, @RepRubenGallego and I held a Special Order on the House Floor to celebrate this phenomenal woman's life. Watch: pic.twitter.com/no4uoUzXqC

More than 30% of Americans believe they will face financial hardship in retirement or won’t be able to retire at all. Today we passed the #SECUREAct—bipartisan legislation that closes loopholes and helps more Americans retire with financial peace of mind.

"A New Life," by Mesa High School student Yennifer Macias was selected as the winner of our 2019 Congressional Art Competition! I’m proud that millions of tourists visiting the U.S. Capitol will see Yennifer’s work representing of our district. #AZ09

Today marks 100 years since the House voted to pass the 19th Amendment, finally granting women the right to vote. Members are wearing yellow roses today to commemorate this special anniversary—and to remind us that the fight for #EqualRights continues. #WomensVote100 pic.twitter.com/DLnWQ5w7AG

No veteran who has selflessly served this nation should ever be without a safe and secure place to call home. I'm cosponsoring the bipartisan Homeless Veteran Families Act to address veteran homelessness and help keep families together while they fight to get back on their feet.

The House just passed H.R. 5, the historic #EqualityAct, to end discrimination against LGBTQ individuals. When it comes to equality, we've come a long way, but we have more work to do to protect and defend the civil rights of every American. pic.twitter.com/yMSZ5OuQEs

The House is about to take a historic vote on H.R. 5, the #EqualityAct. This morning I spoke on the floor in support of the bill because everyone should be treated equally, no matter who they are, who they love, or how they express themselves. #LoveIsLove pic.twitter.com/ol7hKB1VBu
We need a bold infrastructure plan that will invest in Arizona communities and create good jobs. #InfrastructureWeek #BuildTheFuture pic.twitter.com/pZcktgGIFc

My bill to reauthorize and fund the Energy Efficiency Block Grant program would empower states, cities and tribal communities with new resources to reduce emissions and modernize infrastructure. I'm proud it earned unanimous support today from the Energy Subcommittee. https://twitter.com/EnergyCommerce/status/1129032560229658626 …

Tomorrow, the bill I introduced with @RepVeasey to reauthorize and increase funding for the Energy Efficiency and Conservation Block Grant Program will be marked up by @EnergyCommerce. H.R. 2088's movement is a testament to common-sense solutions that can improve our communities.

Our aviation system is the safest in the world, but these accidents have shaken the public’s confidence and trust. Today we hope to learn more about what happened. Watch the hearing live: https://twitter.com/TransportDems/status/1128631045912498176 …

Last night the House passed the Blue Water Navy Vietnam Veterans Act to expand VA health benefits to include veterans exposed to Agent Orange during the Vietnam War. I'm proud to cosponsor this bill, and will continue to stand up for our veterans.

Fleming Begaye Sr. lived a truly remarkable life. As one of more than 400 Navajo Code Talkers who helped develop a secret, unbreakable military code during World War II, Begaye defended our country in ways we may never fully know or appreciate. https://www.azcentral.com/story/news/local/arizona/2019/05/12/navajo-code-talker-fleming-begaye-sr-dies-97-world-war-ii/1183723001/ …

Arizonans know well the unique opportunities and challenges that come with being a border state. As Memorial Day approaches, we reflect on its meaning—to honor those who sacrificed their lives for our country. @CarryTheLoad is honoring the fallen on a 11,000+ mile march with stops at 26 VA National Cemeteries in 17 states. It would repeal a Trump tax hike that forces some spouses of fallen service members to pay thousands more in taxes on survivor benefits.
